sodel oko sonita sonita pu ʦip-seʦ-a sodel-kɔ mɔ-ni dʰaiʔnɔ-ŋɔ sjurime kurime-nɔ ʦʰuk-to ʦʰuk-to dusuba ɔŋkɔ-bi hɔlja-kɔ-m

S.TRANSL: A long long time ago, when we talk of man's creation, (we say) there were two gods in the sky above, Ruwahang and Paruhang.
S.FORM: asina sumnima salama-bo sɔma tʰinʦ-a-m de-ki-lɔ ninambu-ʦoptu mu-ka ʦukʦu-ʦɔ ruwahaŋ paruhaŋ mɔ-ni-m ʦʰa

S.TRANSL: As for those called men, there were none on the earth.
S.FORM: jo idɔ bakʰaju bi pu sɔma det-ka asu jɔ ɔ-mɔ-ni-m ʦʰa
sɔ lɔ sɔmɔ jɔ ɔ-gɔ-m ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: There were not even stones or trees.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ uk ŋiʦi-bi bakʰaju-nɔ sopmu-lɔŋka ribipma pipi tʰinʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then, one day, from the breath of the earth, Ribipma was created.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ ribipma pipi-ja ja ebo ja ebo mu-to mu-to sɔlɔme ʦʰɔʔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: And Ribipma, doing various things, turned into a young woman.

S.FORM: sɔlɔme ʦʰɔʔ-nɔ tɔpa lalu mu-mu lam-u
S.TRANSL: And having become a young woman, she wanted to love a man.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ sɔma-ʦa asu jɔ a-mɔ-ni
S.TRANSL: But there were no men.

S.FORM: dʰam wale-bi dʰam wale-bi silpi-ʦɔ mɔ-ni-m ʦʰa pipi-nɔ ŋɔsu kekewa mɔʔwa kɔretu mɔ-ni
S.TRANSL: At that time there were only birds, and the bird and the thrush were the goddess' friends.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ pipi ne sɔlɔme ʦʰɔʔ-nɔ tɔpa ʦʰap-ka ʦʰɔʔ-lɔ hɔiʔ mu-mu hɔiʔ mu-mu ʦʰɔʔ-lɔ ja kʰuʦ-a ebo kʰuʦ-a ja hiʔ-ni ebo hiʔ-ni ʣara tum-mu-lɔ jɔ kɔpa ɔ-tum-a
S.TRANSL: Then as she became a young woman she started to think about a husband, and she started to wonder "what shall I do?" and she went here and there, and asked here and there, and even searching, she didn't find one.
Then one day she came to know what she needed to do.
S.FORM: dʰanɔ ne sɔmɔ mu-mu mu-mu ʦʰɔʔ-ʣa-lɔ sela ne sela uk malbɔ-bi tumtoʔd-u ʦʰa

S.TRANSL: She knew one day how to love a man.
S.FORM: pipi-ja tumtoʔd-u ʦʰa uk malɔ tɔpa lalu mu-ka
hɔtnɔ tɔpa lalu mo-ki de-ki-lɔ ne kursi-nɔ sɔ-bi ho-mu-nɔ susula mu-mu susula mo-ki-lɔ hjuʔ ho-di
S.TRANSL: The goddess knew one day how to find a husband. We say that this is how we find husbands:we climb up into a walnut tree and whistle, and the wind comes.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ hjuʔ-wa hjuʔ pu lanʦupa tɔpa mɔ-di-m ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: And the wind is like a husband.

S.FORM: dʰaʔnɔ hjuʔ ho-di-kʰa tɔpa lalu mu-da det-ka pipi-ja tumtoʔd-u-m-me kursi-nɔ sɔ-bi huŋ-a-nɔ susula mu ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: It is said that one loves a husband when the wind comes, and after learning this she climbed up the walnut tree and whistled.
Then she climbed up in the walnut tree and whistled.
S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ ne pipi ne kursi-bi huŋ-a-nɔ susula mu ʦʰa

S.TRANSL: The grandfather came and loved her.
S.FORM: dʰailɔ ʦukʦu hɔ-di-nɔ tɔma lalu mu-da ʦʰa

S.TRANSL: She didn't know it, and she gave up on loving a husband, and the days went by, and her spirit dried up (because she was pregnant).
S.FORM: pipi-ja ne tum-ɔ-toʔd-u dʰanɔ pipi-wa tɔpa lalu mu-mu jɔ siʔʦ-a laʔ-a-m-me ɔmnɔ det-to sela det-to pipi-nɔ sagowa haŋ-a ʦʰa

S.TRANSL: And in her mother's stomach, Nayoma was created.
S.FORM: najoʔma mama-nɔ mumu-go-bi mu tʰiŋ-a ʦʰa
mun-nasi ʦʰa mun-nasi-lɔ ne hawa-nɔ ʦi papa-nɔ sagowa heʔ mama-nɔ sagowa mu-lɔ ne mama ne olʣi-mu-mu lam-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: She was created, and while she grew (in utero), the child of the wind made her mother's spirit like her father's, and tried to make her mother vomit.

S.FORM: ip-di lɔ-di ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: She felt like sleeping

S.FORM: hjuʔ heʔŋɔ kʰɔre kʰɔre sagowa najoʔma mu-lɔ ne
S.TRANSL: Nayoma dried her mother's spirit like the wind.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔ mu-to-ŋɔ ɔmnɔ det-to sela det-to ribipma najoʔma waʔ-a
S.TRANSL: Time passed, and Ribipma gave birth to Nayoma.

S.FORM: waʔ-a waʔ-a-nɔ mama-kɔ minʦuma-ʦi-kɔ mɔ-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Ribipma gave birth and the mother and girl child were together.

S.FORM: ɔmnɔ det-to sela det-to kʰɔlɔ kʰɔlɔ mama ʦʰap-mu mu najoʔma jɔ dʰanɔ sela ne ɔmnɔ det-to sela det-to sɔlɔme ʦʰɔʔʦ-a najoʔma
S.TRANSL: Time passed, and Nayoma came to resemble her mother completely. Time passed and Nayoma became a young woman.

S.FORM: najoʔma jɔ tɔpa lalu mu-mu lam-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Najoma too looked for a husband to love.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ tɔpa uma jɔ ja lam-u ebo lam-u mama heʔŋɔ kɔpa jɔ tɔpa lalu a-dʰoʔd-u
S.TRANSL: She searched here and there for the husband, and like her mother she was not able to find a husband to love anywhere.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ ne uk malɔ najoʔma jɔ tumtoʔd-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then one day, Nayoma too knew (where to look)

S.FORM: dʰailɔ ne mama heʔŋɔ kursi-bi ho-mu-nɔ susula mɔ-ki-lɔ hawa ho-di
S.TRANSL: And like her mother, when we climb into a walnut tree and whistle, the wind comes.

S.FORM: tɔpa lalu ʦʰoʔ-o det-ka uma jɔ ʦjuʔd-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: It is said that that is how to find a husband to love, and she learned this.

S.FORM: tan-e-n jɔ ma ne kʰuʦ-a ʦʰa-kʰa kursi huŋ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: After coming down, she went and climbed the walnut tree.

S.FORM: huŋ-a-nɔ susula mu-mu dja-lɔ ne mama tumtoʔd-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: When she climbed and tried to whistle, her mother knew it.

S.FORM: mama hɔ-di-nɔ bʰund-u ʔe laʦi
S.TRANSL: Her mother arrived and scolded her: "hey, traitor.

S.FORM: an ne pʰjakpa ɔ-ʣupd-una
S.TRANSL: Your behavior is not good.

S.FORM: umu ne hjuʔ ne a-papa wɔ ma
S.TRANSL: He is your father, the wind.

S.FORM: asina aŋa tɔpa lalu mu-ŋa-nɔ an ʦʰɔʔ-ɔ-m
S.TRANSL: A while ago, I loved my husband, and begot you.

S.FORM: hɔʔem ma an jɔ laʦi a-papa-ŋɔ anɔ jɔ tɔpa mu-mu bʰaʔ-na ma luʔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Well, then? You are a traitor, and your father too, and you are trying to make him your husband!" she said.

S.FORM: dʰailɔ ne najoʔma ne mama-nɔ dʰaʔe-m ŋis-u-m-me laʣi-ja pumd-u ʦʰa pumd-u-lɔ ne kursi-bika tʰja-tanʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then after Nayoma heard her mother's words, she felt embarassed, and she fell from the walnut tree.

S.FORM: tʰja-tanʦ-a-nɔ tʰja-tanʦ-a dʰanɔ mama kʰuʦ-akʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: She fell down, and her mother left for good.

S.FORM: aʣi ne mewa kekewa-kɔ ʦuksabjɔksa-wa-nusi-ja dʰiʔ-si ʦʰa dʰanɔ umnusi-ja luʔ-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Later, after the birds found her, they said to her:

S.FORM: hɔtnɔ pu hɔtnɔ pu ma heʔ ʦʰɔ ma ɔ-mɔ mɔʦi dja-nɔ tumlo kubimɔpa-butu kʰo-si
S.TRANSL: "How could this be, how did this happen, my niece," they said, and they went up to the shaman.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ kʰɔiʔ-mu lam-usi a-kʰo-si
S.TRANSL: And they tried to bring her away, but couldn't.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ ne kekewa-nɔ lapto-wa pʰind-u-nɔ hjuʔ hɔ-lɔ ne hjuʔ-nɔ sopmu-wa ne najoʔma pʰɔʔ-ɔ tʰinʦa pʰɔʔ-ɔ
S.TRANSL: Then the bird stretched out its wings and the wind came, and the breath of the wind woke Nayoma, made her regain consciousness.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ aŋ ne ʦuksabjaksa-nusi haka hetnɔ aŋu nuwa ʦam-a ma
S.TRANSL: Then (she said) "Helpers, how is it that I lost my mind like this?

S.FORM: hɔtnɔ he ʦʰuk-ʦu ma dja ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: How is it I became like this?" she said

S.FORM: dʰailɔ ne duku ninambu-lɔm sin-u-nɔ ipʰ-a-ba-m
S.TRANSL: Then she looked up at the sky, and fell asleep.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ ne hɔiʔ hɔiʔ lɔ misi ʦʰeld-u-lɔ ne duku ninambu-ʦoptu dʰokʰo ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then somehow, she opened her eyes, and looked up into the sky.

S.FORM: ruwahaŋ mo-ʣe-m ninambu-ʦoptu
S.TRANSL: Ruwahang was up in the sky above.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ ne uma dja ʦʰa lu aŋu tɔpa lalu mu-ŋa-m ho
S.TRANSL: Then she said: "I loved a husband.

S.FORM: tɔpa lalu-bi kʰɔmd-uŋa-m
S.TRANSL: I discovered a husband in love.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ aŋu nam aŋu nuwa rja-di
S.TRANSL: Then I became dizzy.

S.FORM: duku dʰo-m butu-m dʰo-m asu wɔ dʰo-m
S.TRANSL: Who is he, the one up above?

S.FORM: aŋu tɔpa lalu mu-mu ʦʰo
S.TRANSL: I must have a husband to love.

S.FORM: tɔpa lalu aŋ kur-ʦusi
S.TRANSL: Bring me a husband to love.

S.FORM: aŋ dʰo-m butu kʰɔiʔ-mu ɔ-ʦap-dɔ
S.TRANSL: I cannot go up there.

S.FORM: anʦi kʰɔiʔ-mu ʦapʰ-isina
S.TRANSL: You two can go up there.

S.FORM: dʰo-m tɔpa lalu kur-ʦusi lu-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: She said to them: "Bring me that husband from up above to love"

S.FORM: dʰanɔ ne dʰaiʔnɔ bɔʔri bi-si-m-me kekewa-nusi lɔʦ-asi ʦʰa duku ʦukʦu-butu
S.TRANSL: And after she gave them the command, the birds went up to the god up above.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ joʔ-ka kekewa-nusi lɔʦ-ɔsi-lɔ ne ruwahaŋ ʦukʦu ne kʰuʦ-akʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then the birds went out from below and the god Ruwahang had gone.

S.FORM: umbi ne paruhaŋ hɔ-di ʦʰa paru uduʦu hɔ-di ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Paruhang came there (instead).

S.FORM: dʰanɔ paruwa uduʦu mɔ-ʣa-lɔ kekewa-nusi hɔbaʦ-asi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: While Paruwa (other name of Paruhang) was there, the birds arrived.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ hɔbaʦ-asi-nɔ ne luʔ-si ʦʰa kekewa-nusi-wa
S.TRANSL: After arriving, the birds said:

S.FORM: ʦukʦu sjakʰɔnʦ-ekɔ ani ne
S.TRANSL: "We greet you, Grandfather.

S.FORM: umbi ani basakʰɔm-bi ɔnʦu dʰum-di kʰuw-asu-m-me lule bja-su
S.TRANSL: We came up to your house in order to meet you, so bless us!"
The god said : " OK, OK, liars, how so, you came to ask for my blessing?
S.FORM: ʦukʦu-wa lɔ lɔ laʦi-nusi hɔiʔlɔ lule pʰi-di kʰuw-asina ma anʦi
i-butu ne asu jɔ sɔma oko jɔ mo-ni
S.TRANSL: No human comes up here ever.

S.FORM: anʦi kʰuw-asina kekewa-nusi sɔmɔ deʔ-di kʰuw-asina ma lu bʰaʦ-asi
S.TRANSL: What did you two birds come here to say, come on, say it!

S.FORM: hɔiʔ kʰo deʔ-di kʰoʦ-asina hɔiʔ sɔmɔ kʰoʦ-asina
S.TRANSL: What did you come to say? What did you bring?

S.FORM: kʰuw-asina ma del
S.TRANSL: What did you come for?"

S.FORM: juku najoʔma pipi ne bakʰaju-bi nuwa ʦam-a tɔpa lalu mu-mu ɔ-dʰoʔd-u-kʰa
S.TRANSL: "Nayoma lost her mind down on earth because she can't find a husband.

S.FORM: ani dʰokʦ-a kʰuʦ-ani ase ne
S.TRANSL: She saw you earlier when you came.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ pipi-ja dja-di ʦuk dʰo-m ʦukʦu jaʔ-ŋa
S.TRANSL: Then she said: "I love him, the one up above.

S.FORM: tɔpa lalu mu-mu kur-ʦusi aŋ tɔpa kur-ʦusi dja-kʰa
S.TRANSL: Bring me a husband to love" she said.

S.FORM: ɔnʦu pipi-ja pʰiŋ-asu-kʰa ɔnʦu kʰuw-asu-m ʦukʦu ani li-di ani juku pipi-bo tan-nini-n tʰe tan-musi ʦʰo
S.TRANSL: And then she sent us, and then we came up, Grandfather, to take you down to Grandmother, let's go down, come down, let us go down."

S.FORM: dʰanɔ ne paruwa uduʦu ʦukʦu-wa dja ʦʰa ʔe laʦi-nusi sɔmɔ bʰaʦ-isina anʦi-ja
S.TRANSL: Then Paruwa Uduchu said :"Hey, liars, what are you saying?

S.FORM: aŋ ne heʔlɔ malɔ hu-ʦu-m ibi ne ase ruwahaŋ ʦukʦu mɔ-di-m tʰijo anʦi pipi-ja dʰokʰo-m ne
S.TRANSL: I just came here now, before it was Ruwahang who was here, whom your Grandmother saw..

S.FORM: ruwahaŋ pu ma aŋ ne meʔe
S.TRANSL: I am not Ruwahang.

S.FORM: aŋ ne parʣimɔ ʣipʣimɔ kɔ-m deʔe-m ʣʰar-mu-kodo mu-tɔ
S.TRANSL: I will be despicable like this with my wounds and sores.

S.FORM: aŋ anʦi pipi-ja a-jaʔ-ʦu-m he aŋ ɔ-jaʔ-tɔ luʔ-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Your Grandmother will not like me. She will not like me," he said to them.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ jɔ kekewa-kɔ purukti-nusi-ja ne a-repd-usi ʦʰa tan-musi ʦʰo tan-musi ʦʰo dja-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Even then the birds didn't believe him: "You must come down, you must come down!" they said to him.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ ʦukʦu-wa luʔ-si ʦʰa ʔe laʦi-nusi aŋ ɔ-kʰɔt-tɔ heʔlɔ
S.TRANSL: Then the Grandfather said to them: "Hey, liars, I am not going now.

S.FORM: aŋu sikewa kʰuʦ-asi-nɔ a-pipi bja-si
S.TRANSL: Bring away (this sign of) my skill, and give it to Grandmother.

S.FORM: idɔ a-sikewa tʰɔkɔrna jaʔ-da-kʰo pu aŋ li-di kʰuw-asi
S.TRANSL: If she likes this comb (made through) my skill, then come get me.

S.FORM: heʔlɔ pu idɔ sikewa kʰoʦ-asi-nɔ pipi bja-si hɔi luʔ-si-nɔ laso tʰɔkɔrna bi-gʰud-usi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Now bring away this skill and give it to Grandmother" he said, and gave them the comb as a sign to bring down.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ dʰam-kɔ gʰɔ-si-lɔ ne laso be-ki-lɔ ne laso-bi ŋajowa ne a-gʰo
S.TRANSL: And when they went down with it and gave the sign, the face did not come down in the sign.

S.FORM: dʰam-bi ne kekewa-nusi gʰud-usi ʦʰa najoʔma mɔ-di-m-bi
S.TRANSL: The birds brought it there, to where Nayoma was.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ najoʔma bi ʦʰa ʦukʦu-nɔ sikewa mɔkewa dʰanɔ ne sikewa mɔkewa dʰokʰo-m-bi-nɔ najoʔma ne jaʔ-kʰoʦ-a
S.TRANSL: Then (they brought) the skill and craft to Nayoma, and when she saw it, she came to love him.

S.FORM: tɔpa lalu dja-di ʦʰa he kʰanuppa sikewa mɔkewa mu-ka mina haka ɔ-jaʔ-dɔ
S.TRANSL: "I love him" she said "why would I not love a person with such skill and craft?"

S.FORM: lu heʔlɔ-ŋɔ kʰuʦ-asi-nɔ heʔlɔ-ŋɔ gʰukʦ-asi ma luʔ-si-nɔ pʰiŋ-usi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: OK go now and bring him back" she said and sent them away.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ pʰiŋ-usi-nɔ lɔʦ-asi ʦʰa kekewa-nusi duku ninambu-ʦoptu paru uduʦu-ʦoptu
S.TRANSL: Then she sent them away and the birds left (for) Paruhang up in the sky above.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ ne luʦuk hɔbaʦ-asi-nɔ ne lu ʦukʦu ani ne jaʦ-ani pipi-ja pipi-ja dja-kʰa lu taʦ-iki tʰe luʔ-ni-me lɔ tan-nisu ma
S.TRANSL: So they went there "hey Grandfather, Grandmother loves you, she says, so let's go down" they said "OK, let's go.

S.FORM: anʦi-ja dja-sina-kʰo a-pipi-ja dja-kʰo aŋ aʣi tan-nisu-nɔ a-pipi-ja ɔ-jaʔ-tɔ-kʰo pu aŋa sɔma tʰin-mu-nɔ kʰo-mu-ŋɔ ʦʰo
S.TRANSL: If you said (so), if your Grandmother said (so), I will come down now, and if your Grandmother does not like me, I will have to create man and come back up.

S.FORM: aŋɔ a-waʔriwa dʰam bela a-pipi-ja a-jaʔ-to-kʰo a-waʔriwa senʦ-isina
S.TRANSL: If your Grandmother does not like me, you will see my behaviour.

S.FORM: aŋa waiʔturi kʰɔn-nini
S.TRANSL: I will curse you.

S.FORM: laʦi-nusi lu lɔmtʰja-si dja-nɔ rek-pu tin sɔ-pu-ŋɔ gʰɔʔ-ni ʦʰa rek-pu-ŋɔ gʰɔʔ-ni-nɔ pipi-nɔ ŋajɔ-bi wake-bi hɔgʰɔʔ-ni pipi-ja ne paru uduʦu ʦukʦu ne a-jaʔ-a
S.TRANSL: Ok traitors, let's go" he said and the three, including the two (birds), came down. The three came down and when they were in the presence of Grandmother, she did not like Paruhang.

S.FORM: par-kɔm gʰja-kʦ-a-m
S.TRANSL: His face (=wounded mouth) was festering.

S.FORM: dʰailɔ ne lu aŋa ne asu deʔ-ʦu-m asu kʰuʦ-asina lu idɔ ne ja kʰuʦ-asi kʰuʦ-asi kʰuʦ-asi ɔ-jaʔ-dɔ aŋa idɔ ne asu wɔ sɔmɔ huʦ-asina hɔ
S.TRANSL: "So, the one I spoke of, then, who is he, who is it you brought? Hey, take this one away, take him away! I don't like this one. What did you bring?"

S.FORM: luʔ-si-lɔ ne ʦukʦu-nɔ ne ʦili huʦ-a
S.TRANSL: When she said "this one you brought, who is he, what is he?" the Grandfather got angry.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ ʦukʦu-nɔ ʦili gʰuʦ-a-m-me waiʔturi bi-ni
S.TRANSL: Then, when the Grandfather got angry, he cursed them.

S.FORM: waiʔturi bi-ni-lɔ ne ʦukʦu-wa mind-u pʰe mind-u aʣi ne idɔ a-ʦi-ʦɔ-ŋɔ ho a-sakʰam-ʦɔ-ŋɔ idɔ-ʦɔ jɔ
S.TRANSL: When he cursed, the Grandfather remembered, "these are my children (as he is a god), these are my descendants."

S.FORM: sukpa dʰoʔ-dani-lɔ ne aŋ wɔ waiʔturi-bi aŋ bi wɔ kuhuli ne tʰiŋ-e dja-kʰa ja-tʰɔm kʰo-si-nɔ kekewa-nusi-lai lule bi-dasi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: After he said "When they find suffering, a dark cloud is created around me" and he brings/brought the birds nearby and blesses them.

S.FORM: hɔi luʔ-si ʦʰa bʰəne kʰɔlɔ ʦukʦu-nɔ waiʔturi-wa hir-a-m-me idɔ bakʰaju kʰɔlɔ-ŋɔ ʦʰeku hɔ-mu-su ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: As he had told them, the Grandgather got angry and with his curse, he dried up all the water in the world.

S.FORM: hɔ-mu-su-m-me ne idɔ-ʦa sukpa dʰoʔ-dani dja-nɔ mind-u-m-me ja-tʰɔm kʰu-si-nɔ kekewa-kɔ purukti-nusi-lai-nusi lule bi-si
S.TRANSL: After drying up the world, he remembered that there is suffering, and brought the birds nearby and blessed them.

S.FORM: anʦi pipi-nɔ nuwa ʦam-a heʔlɔ aʣi nuwa ʦʰe-di-m-me a-pipi kʰama miʦ-e
S.TRANSL: "Your Grandmother lost her mind. Now later, after she regains consciousness, she will feel thirsty.

S.FORM: kʰama miʦ-e-lɔ kɔŋkʰa kɔpa jɔ ɔ-dʰiʦ-isina
S.TRANSL: When she feels thirsty you will not find water anywhere.

S.FORM: kɔŋkʰa aŋa ɔ-waiʔturi-lɔŋka hɔ-mu-ŋa ase-ŋɔ luʔ-nasi-m a-waiʔturi sin-asi
S.TRANSL: With my curse, I dried up the water. Look at my curse I spoke of before.

S.FORM: aʣi a-pipi tʰinʦ-e-lɔ aŋ jambo kʰoksi-nɔ sɔpʰo-bi ʦer-di-tɔ-m ʦʰoʔ-o
S.TRANSL: Later when your Grandmother comes to, I have urinated over there on a yam leaf.

S.FORM: dʰam biʦ-asi-nɔ anɔ kulu ʦʰemke mɔ-si kulu-bi rjuʔʦ-asi
S.TRANSL: Give it to her, and sprinkle it on her face.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ nuwa ʦʰe-di-m-me umbo-ŋɔ uŋnusi umu a-pipi kʰuʦ-asi-nɔ sɔ-pu kʰur sɔ-pu kutta tjuʔʦ-asi-nɔ kɔm-wa du-mɔ-si
S.TRANSL: Once she has regained consciousness, bring your Grandmother there and stand her on both arms and both legs and make her drink with her mouth."

S.FORM: dʰanɔ pu kɔŋkʰa kʰɔlɔ-bi-ŋɔ ʣara-bi-ŋɔ tʰiŋ-e
S.TRANSL: Then water comes from all sides.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔ luʔ-dasi-nɔ umnusi ɔʔʦ-a-kʰuʦ-asi ɔt-na kʰu-nasi ʦʰa ʦuk ʦukʦu
S.TRANSL: After he says that to them, they went back, and Grandfather went back.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ ne aʣi aʣi ne pipi-nɔ nuwa hɔ-di-m-me umnusi ʦukʦu-wa kʰoksi-nɔ sɔpʰo-bi ʦir-a-dja-m ʦerkʰam li-di kʰuʦ-asi-nɔ kekewa purukti-ja pu-wa bʰiʔ-nɔ pok lapto-wa pipi-nɔ kulu-bi rjuʔ-kʰɔnd-u-lɔ nuwa hɔʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then much later, after Grandmother had come to, they went to the pee which Grandfather had urinated on a yam leaf, and the bird brought her and with their wings sprinkled her face and her mind returned.

S.FORM: lu aŋ ne ʦʰeku kɔŋkʰa kur-ʦusi kʰama mu-ʦu
S.TRANSL: "Hey, bring me to some water, I am thirsty"

S.FORM: tɔpɔra meʔe pipi ʦʰeku kɔŋkʰa du-di ne ani-ŋɔ kʰɔiʔ-mu ʦʰo jaʔ-kʰo kur-mu-nɔ bʰiʔ-mu a-no-di ʦʰa-me
S.TRANSL: "There is no plate, Grandmother, in order to drink water, you must go. We can't carry it and bring it near there,"

S.FORM: luʔ-si-nɔ kʰo-si ʦʰa kʰo-si-m-me luʔ-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: They said to her and carried her, and after they brought her there they said:

S.FORM: pipi idɔ kɔŋkʰa ne sɔ-pu kʰur sɔ-pu pʰɔʔmal tjuʔ-mu-nɔ kɔm-wa du-mu ʦʰo luʔ-si-nɔ ʦukʦu-wa dja-m heʔŋɔ mu-si-nɔ tjuʔd-usi-nɔ du-mu bi-si-lɔ ne duŋ-u
S.TRANSL: "Grandmother, you must stand on both arms and both legs and drink this water with your mouth" they said and they did as the Grandfather said and put her on all fours and had her drink.

S.FORM: du-mu-me ne ana pipi-nɔ sagowa gobi ne kʰɔlɔ ʣara tʰiŋ-akʦ-a mumu kur-di
S.TRANSL: And after drinking, all things were created inside her soul, for her stomach to bear.

S.FORM: dʰam-me kɔŋkʰa ʣa kʰɔlɔ ʣara bal-ŋɔ tʰiŋ-a
S.TRANSL: Then water appeared in all places.

S.FORM: dʰam tʰiŋ-a-m-me dʰaiʔnɔ-ŋɔ mɔ-ʣe-ni-m-me pipi-ja ʦi wat-ka ʦʰɔʔ-ɔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: After that water appeared, then all things were (as they were) and Grandmother came to give birth to a child, and things were so.

S.FORM: dʰainɔ dʰainɔ mu-to mu-to mɔ-ni-lɔ ne uk malɔ ne najoʔma ne ʦi wat-ka ʦʰɔʔ-ɔ-m-me ne nuwa ʣʰam-a ʦʰa ŋiʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then, after a while, one day Nayoma gave birth to a child, and then she became dizzy and was sick.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ dʰi-ho-si ʦʰa kekewa-nusi-ja
S.TRANSL: The birds found and brought her.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ kekewa luʔ-si kekewa-nusi kʰo-si ʦʰa tjuʔri mɔʔwakɔretu kubimɔpa lahaku lɔreku-butu-nɔ basakʰɔm
S.TRANSL: The birds said [we need to help her] and the birds and shamans decided [verb 'mumu' missing after 'tjuʔri'] to have the helpers carry her to his (shaman's) house in Lahaku Loreku.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ lahaku lɔreku-butu kʰuʦ-asi-nɔ luʔ-si ʦʰa kubimɔpa mɔʔwakɔretu ani mɔʣɔi hɔiʔ ʦʰɔʔ-ɔ-m wɔ haka ŋiʦ-a-m wɔ sɔmɔ ʦʰɔʔ-ɔ-m wɔ dja-nɔ ʦjuri bi-si-lɔ ne ʦjuri kɔʦu koʔd-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then they went up to Lahaku Loreku, and they said to the bird and the shaman : "How did your niece get like this? Why is she ill? What happened?" he said and they [the helpers] sent a message [to the mɔʔwa kɔretu] , and he [the shaman] cut ginger (to see the message).

S.FORM: sin-u-lɔ ne ana mɔnʣi-ja ne ʦi wat-ka wɔ sɔma kʰɔlɔ ʣara lɔ-ʦɔ kʰɔlɔ kʰɔlɔ kʰɔlɔ sɔma-ʦɔ wɔ bɔkpa-ʦɔ wɔ tʰin-ka ʦʰɔʔ-ɔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: He saw that his niece had given birth, and all men and all stones and all people and all four-legged animals had been created.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ luʔ-si ʦʰa ʔe laʦi-nuʦi mɔnʣi-ja ne kʰɔlɔ kʰɔlɔ tɔpa lalu mu ʦʰa-kʰa sɔma bɔkpa tʰin-ka ʦʰɔʔ-ɔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then he said to them, "hey, liars, my niece loved a man and because of that all of mankind and animalkind were created.

S.FORM: kʰɔlɔ mund-u ʦʰa anɔ mumu-bi mund-uni ʦʰa dja-di-m-me kʰuʦ-asi kʰɔlɔ ʦʰoʔ-o-m liʦ-a-suʦ-ani
S.TRANSL: She created everything in her stomach, she created them" he said, "go, remove all those which have come to be.

S.FORM: aʣi ana kʰur-bi lipʰuwa rilipʰu lipʰuwa kur-da-nɔ ʦʰoʔ-o-m pu-nɔ pu-nɔ ana munmuri kʰokʦ-a-kʰɔnʦ-asi
S.TRANSL: Then he cut the belly button of the one carrying a bow and arrow in his hand and having been born.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ sɔ-pu ʦʰekuma-nusi ʦʰoʔ-si umnusi pu kʰur-bi buwa-kɔ dʰoʔo nɔ dʰoʔ kur-dasi-m ʦʰoʔ-o
S.TRANSL: Then there are two girls, they are carrying flowers and looms in their hands.

S.FORM: dʰam-nusi pu dja-ni dja-si kʰɔlɔ ʣara pu liʦ-a-suʦ-asi luʔ-si-nɔ pʰiŋ-usi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Put those, put them (with their mother), and remove all (the others)" he said to them and sent them away.

S.FORM: dʰaʔe-m ʦjuʔri gʰud-usi-nɔ hɔʦ-asi-lɔ ne juku ŋis-mu-si ʦʰa najoʔma-lai
S.TRANSL: Then after they brought down the message, they made Nayoma listen.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ najoʔma ne sɔmɔ ʦʰuk-ʦu ʦʰa ma ʔe ʦjuksabjaksa-nusi aŋ haka heʔ ʦʰuk-ʦu-m ma lu-si-lɔ ne
S.TRANSL: Then Nayoma (said) : "Hey, helpers, what happened to me? Why did I get to be like this?"

S.FORM: an ne pipi ʦukʦu-wa kubimɔpa dja-kʰa ne kʰɔlɔ mun-ka ʦʰɔʔ-na ʦʰa tɔpa lalu mu-na ʦʰa sɔma tʰin-dana ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: "You, Grandmother, because Grandfather said to the shaman that you would create all things, you loved a man, and you created all men."

S.FORM: ʔe najeʔma dja ʦʰa ʔe a-kuku-wa ne kubimɔpa ne dʰaiʔwɔ dja-di aŋ heʔe-m miʔ-mu bʰak-tɔ-m bela heʔe-m jok-tɔ-m bela tɔpa-nɔ ŋajuwa ɔ-dʰokʰɔiʔ-mu-ŋɔ kʰɔlɔ mun-ka ʦʰuk-ʦu
S.TRANSL: "Yes" said Nayoma" "Yes, even though my uncle, the shaman, said that, at the time when I feel like dying like this, at the time when I'm acting like this I have not seen my husband's face, yet I have created all things.

S.FORM: tɔpa lalu mu-ŋa
S.TRANSL: I loved my husband.

S.FORM: um jɔ aŋ heʔŋɔ ʦʰuʔ-ne a-kuku aŋ heʔŋɔ jɔ kuhuli-wa sɔkɔlɔkɔ hepd-u ne ho
S.TRANSL: He (my uncle) also said "be like me, be like me". A black cloud hugged him.

S.FORM: dja-lɔ dʰaiʔnɔ waʔriwa leʔ-e-m-me ne bɔʔri leʔ-e-m-me ne duku ʦeʦelu kʰerekʰa-butu mɔ-ʣe-m kubimɔpa ne ʦʰeku-bi ʦem-na-ʣi-nasi-m ʦʰa sumdikʰa-bi
S.TRANSL: He said this, and then, after chiding and promising, the shaman was up on the hillside above Kherekha playing in the water, playing in the spring and the water.

S.FORM: juku joʔ-ka kuhuli tʰiŋ-a-nɔ ne kʰuw-a-lɔ ne mɔmd-u-lɔ hɔiʔ mu-musi hɔiʔ mu-musi ʦʰɔ-lɔ moʔwakɔretu ne
S.TRANSL: A black cloud appeared and came and surrounded him, and he said "what shall I do? What shall I do?"

S.FORM: ana kɔm-kɔ pʰɔʔmal-kɔ kɔŋkʰa-gobo nam-u-nɔ sul-nasi ʦʰɔʔ-ɔ-lɔ kʰɔlɔ ana rɔm-bi-m pu mɔsukulu ʦʰɔʔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: And he dove with his mouth and feet in the water and hid and on all his (unhidden) body he became black.
From that day, having done that, the black cloud was finished.
S.FORM: dʰam ŋiʦi-bika dʰainɔ mu-m-me kuhuli ŋir-a
dʰanɔ ʦuŋ-a aʣi ne najeʔma-nɔ nuwa ʦam-a-m-me najoʔma ne kʰɔlɔ ʣara waiʔ-mu bʰuʔ-mu bʰuk-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Later, after it was over and Nayoma had lost her mind, she gave birth to all things.

S.FORM: bʰuk-to bʰuk-to bʰuk-to kʰuʦ-a-lɔ ne aʣi ne kubimɔpa dja-m ne ʦam-dasi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: And while she was giving birth, (her helpers) forgot the things the shaman said.

S.FORM: moʔwakɔretu ne sen ʔe moʔwakɔretu-wa dja-di-m-me kekewa-nusi-ja dʰaiʔlɔ aʣi ne nu misi kɔm gɔ-di-m mina wɔ kʰod-usi-lɔ ne umu ne bɔksukpa ʦʰɔ ʦʰa umu pʰe dʰaʔe-m-ŋɔ ʦʰɔ
S.TRANSL: The things the birds said to the shaman... then later they cut (the umbilical cord of) a person with a nose, eyes and a mouth, but it was a lion. [they made a mistake in looking for the humans]

S.FORM: dʰam-me kʰoʔd-usi dʰam-me jɔ nuru ʦʰɔʔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then they cut the umbilical cord, and it was a leopard.

S.FORM: aʣi pʰe kʰod-usi umu ne kʰiba ʦʰɔʔ-ɔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then later they again cut (the umbilical cord mistakenly) and it was a dog.

S.FORM: umbika ne a aʣi ne kʰoʔd-usi kʰoʔd-usi-lɔ ne aʣi tʰɔka kʰur-bi lje rilipʰu kur-usi-nɔ kur-u-nɔ sɔma ʦʰɔʔ-ɔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Later they cut (the umbilical cords) and they cut them, and there was a man carrying an arrow in his hand.

S.FORM: dʰailɔ umnusi-nɔ nuwa ʦʰja-di ʦʰa hokane
S.TRANSL: And then they regained their minds.

S.FORM: dʰam-nɔ jɔ munmuri kʰoʔd-usi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: They cut his belly button as well.

S.FORM: munmuri kʰoʔd-usi-nɔ mɔ-si-lɔ ne aʣi ne ana ʦʰekuma-nusi wɔ oko-nɔ kʰur-bi dʰoʔo-kɔ-m ʦʰɔʔ-ɔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: And when they had cut his belly button, later his two sisters appeared, one with a loom in her hand.

S.FORM: dʰam-me munmuri kʰoʔd-usi ʦʰa nuwa ʣʰjɔn ʦʰeŋa [+uninterpretable bit]
S.TRANSL: After that they cut the belly button, and they regained their minds.

S.FORM: kʰiba ne kʰoʔd-usi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: And they cut the dog's (umbilical cord).

S.FORM: kʰɔlɔ-nɔ kʰo-kʰɔnd-usi-lɔ ne kim mama-ŋɔ hu-ka-nɔ mu-ka ʦʰɔ-ni
S.TRANSL: They cut the belly-buttons of all, and they waited and stayed with their mother in the house.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ ne sɔmɔ mu-mu sɔmɔ mu-mu ʦʰɔ-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then, they both said "what shall we do? What shall we do?"

S.FORM: tumlo pʰand-usi-nɔ
S.TRANSL: They failed in their work.

S.FORM: aʣi aʣi ne kʰɔlɔ mu mama hu-ka ʦʰa-nɔ mɔ-ni ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Later, they all waited and stayed with their mother.

S.FORM: dʰainɔ mu-to mu-to ja ebo mu-to mu-to kʰɔlɔ-ŋɔ bʰɔrtɔ kʰuʦ-ani ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Time passed, and they got bigger.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ sela sela ne nuru-kɔ sɔma-kɔ pu s sapko mu-di kʰuʦ-asi ʦʰa saplɔ ho-si ʦʰa pa-ni ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then, time passed, and Leopard and the man went hunting and they went to the forest and ate.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔnɔŋɔ mu-to mɔ-ni-lɔ saplɔ kʰuʦ-asi-lɔ pu nuru-kɔ sɔma pu-wa dʰɔʔʣam kʰo-si-m ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: They were there, and when they went to the jungle, the man and Leopard had brought a snack.

S.FORM: dʰɔʔʣam pu sɔma-lai ɔ-dʰɔiʔ-mu-ŋɔ nuru-wa lat-ka ʣi-ka-nɔ kim ɔt-kasi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Leopard didn't save the snack for the human, and took it out, ate it, and went home.

S.FORM: sɔma pu soʔwa-ŋɔ hu-ka dʰaiʔnɔ-ŋɔ dʰaiʔnɔ-ŋɔ mu-lɔ sela sela ne sɔma ɔ-mu ɔ-ʦapd-u-nɔ mama hiʦ-a
S.TRANSL: The human got hungry and soon he could not endure it and he asked his mother:

S.FORM: maʔa bubu-lai lule bja-ni lule kʰɔnʦ-ani
S.TRANSL: "Mother, you must warn older brother.

S.FORM: aŋ bubu-wa halo jɔ dʰɔʔʣam ɔ-dʰɔt-tɔ
S.TRANSL: Older brother never saves me any snack.

S.FORM: aŋ soʔwa-ŋɔ ʦʰuk-tɔ-m mu-tɔ aŋa gʰɔm ŋi rilipʰu-wa ɔp-se-dɔ
S.TRANSL: I get hungry, and doing that, some day, I will shoot and kill him with an arrow."

S.FORM: dʰaiʔ lu-m-me mama lule bi-su ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Mother told him that, and warned him.

S.FORM: a-bɔkʦi an rilipʰu ɔpʦ-isina
S.TRANSL: "Your brother will shoot and kill you.

S.FORM: dʰɔʔʣam-bi a-waʔriwa ʣupd-u luʔ-ni-m-me ʔe dja ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Improve your behavior around the snack" she said, and he said "OK".

S.FORM: nuru-wa dʰaiʔ de-kʰo ne ʦeʔ-paŋ-dɔ dja ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: "If he says that, I will tear him apart and eat him" he said.

S.FORM: uk malɔ kʰuʦ-asi ʦʰa kʰuʦ-asi-nɔ ne bɔkʦi-ja dʰɔʔʣam ʣa ʦʰa bubu pu saplɔ-lɔm kʰuʦ-a-m dʰanɔ bɔkʦi-nɔ gu-ʦa-kɔ jo-tʰɔm lɔ-ʦoptu da ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: One day, they both went, and the younger brother ate the snack. The older one, meanwhile, went to the forest, and then the younger brother put his (own) clothes down below, above a rock.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ rilipʰu kind-u-nɔ sɔ-ʦoptu huŋ-a-nɔ mɔ-dja ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then he stretched an arrow, went up into a tree, and stayed there.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ ne dʰɔʔʣam da-si-m-bi ɔ-dʰoʔd-usi-lɔ ne nuru ne ʦili gʰuʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then when he didn't find the snack at the place where they had put it, Leopard got angry.

S.FORM: ʦili gʰuʦ-a-lɔ ne hir-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: When his anger rose up, he got angry.

S.FORM: hir-a-lɔ ne ja pʰamd-u pʰamd-u-lɔ ne bɔkʦi rja ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: When he was angry, he scratched there, and when he scratched, his brother laughed.

S.FORM: a-rja-di bɔkʦi ja ebo sin-u-lɔ ne bɔkʦi-nɔ gu dʰokʰo ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: And then younger brother didn't laugh, and when Leopard looked here and there, he saw his younger brother's clothes.

S.FORM: bɔkʦi-nɔ gu wɔ kʰɔlɔ ʦe-su-lɔ ne bɔkʦi rja-di ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: And when he had finished ripping his brother's clothes up, the younger brother laughed.

S.FORM: dʰokʰod-u sɔ-ʦoptu-ka rja-di-lɔ ne bɔkʦi-bo-ŋɔ pʰamd-u kʰuʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: When he laughed from up in the tree, Leopard scratched and went where the brother was.

S.FORM: bɔkʦi-nɔ palo aŋ bubu seʔ-tɔ ʦʰa aŋ seʔ-tɔ-m-kʰo ne aŋa umu seʔ-mu ʣupʰ-e dja ʦʰa-kʰa ɔps-e ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: The brother's turn (came): "He will kill me. Rather than him killing me, it would be good if I killed him" he said and then he shot him.

S.FORM: rilipʰu-wa ɔps-e ʦʰa ɔps-e-nɔ bubu-wa hom saʔ sapko pu kur-u-nɔ kim ɔt-nasi
S.TRANSL: After he shot with the arrow, after he shot, and carried back the kill killed by his brother and returned home.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ mama luʔ ʦʰa ʔe sɔma halo jɔ an-bika ne dʰu ne a-bubu ho-di-m
S.TRANSL: Then mother said "hey, Human, your brother always comes much before you.

S.FORM: ɔmnɔ haka an dʰu hɔ-na luʔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Why did you come earlier today?" she said.

S.FORM: meʔe bubu jam-bal bʰeʔ-ʣe dja ʦʰa sɔma
S.TRANSL: "No, brother is nearby, coming" he said.

S.FORM: dʰai det-to det-to aʣi ne bubu ɔ-hɔ-di mama mind-u ʦʰa idɔ-nɔ lule-wa ɔ-kʰɔnd-u bɔkʦi-ja seʔ-nɔ hɔ lu
S.TRANSL: Later on, Brother had not come, and Mother remembered. He had not respected her warning, and his brother had killed him and come.

S.FORM: kʰuʦ-asi ʦʰa kʰiba-kɔ najoʔma lam-to lam-to lam-to kʰuʦ-asi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: They went, Nayoma and Dog did, they went searching and searching.

S.FORM: ʦʰuŋɔ bɔkʦi-ja ɔps-e-m dʰi-si-nɔ ma dʰam mama najoʔma-kɔ gɔ-di-m ʦʰa mina tʰin-ka
S.TRANSL: Actually, they found Leopard, who had been killed by the younger brother. He was with Nayoma.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ mama ja ebo mu-nɔ tʰind-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Mother stayed there and aroused him.

S.FORM: tumlo-lɔŋka tʰind-u-m-me dja ʦʰa nuru-wa maʔa aŋ ne habo ip-ʣi-ʦu ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: She aroused him with a prayer, and Leopard said "Mother, how much did I sleep?"

S.FORM: hɔ ipʰ-a-ʣa-na-m-me aŋɔ lule-wa ɔ-kʰɔnʦ-ana-kʰa a-bɔkʦi ɔpʦ-a-siʦ-ana-m
S.TRANSL: "Yes, you were sleeping, your brother shot and killed you. You did not heed to my warning, and your brother shot and killed you."

S.FORM: ʔe dʰai-kʰo ne lu maʔa ɔmnɔ-bika aŋ ɔ-kʰɔt-tɔ kim aŋu aŋa mu-ka ʣi-ka kʰaruwa uduwa ibi-ŋɔ bid-uʦunu lu dja-lɔ mama bi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: "Hey, if that's the case, Mother, from today I will not go home, come on Mother, give me my place to be and eat, my land" he said, and Mother gave it to him.

S.FORM: lu kʰɔlɔ idɔ sap saplɔ pu anɔ-ŋɔ luʔ-ni ʦʰa dʰanɔ bi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: "Here, this forest is all yours," she said and gave it to him.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ aʣi mama-kɔ kʰiba-kɔ kʰɔt-ka bela luʔ ʦʰa maʔa kim-bi ne bɔkʦi-ʦɔ mo-ni bigja-nɔ ʦi-ʦɔ mo-ni kʰɔlɔ mo-ni
S.TRANSL: Later, at the time when Mother and Dog were leaving, he said "Mother, my brothers are at home, and my sisters, and everyone.

S.FORM: ibi ne aŋ mɔtɔi ʦʰuk-ʦu inʦi mo-si ibi luʔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: I am all alone here. Let us both stay here" he said.

S.FORM: luʔ dʰai-kʰo ma aŋ jɔ mu-tɔ kʰiba an pu ɔt-nasi
S.TRANSL: When he said that, "I too will stay. Dog, you return.

S.FORM: an sɔma sɔmɔ sɔmɔ be-na sɔmɔ sɔmɔ de dʰam repd-u-nɔ ʣa pakʰa-bi mɔ luʔ-nɔ pʰiŋ-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Human will give you things: obey him, and eat, and stay outside" she said, and she sent him away.

S.FORM: aʣi sɔma-ʦɔ bigjame-ʦɔ made mɔ-ni-m ʦʰɔ kim-bi mɔ-ʣa ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: So it is that Human and the sisters stayed, they stayed in the house.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ jaʔ-kʰo saplɔ-bi pu mama-kɔ nuru-kɔ mɔ-si-lɔ ne unʦi same ɔ-dɔnd-u ʦʰa tɔpa-kɔ tɔma heʔŋɔ ʦʰɔ-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: And near there in the jungle, were Mother and Leopard, and their clan was not united, as they were like husband and wife.

S.FORM: dʰailɔ ne sɔmɔ jɔ ɔ-dʰoʔd-usi ʣi-ka du-ka soʔwa-ŋɔ ʦʰɔ-si-lɔ nuru-wa dja ʦʰa uk malɔ uk ŋiʦi
S.TRANSL: They could not find anything to eat, and they were hungry, and one day Leopard said:

S.FORM: lu maʔa inʦi-nɔ same ɔ-dɔnd-u inʦi sɔmɔ jɔ ʣi-mu ɔ-dʰokʦ-asi
S.TRANSL: "Hey Mother, our clan is not united, we could not find anything to eat.

S.FORM: an wabu wale-lɔm mo-na-lɔ aŋ dʰo ʦeʦelu-lɔm lɔn-tɔ
S.TRANSL: When you stay in the Tarai, I will go up to the hills.

S.FORM: ʦeʦelu-lɔm an lɔʦ-ena-lɔ aŋ wabu wale tan-nisu
S.TRANSL: When you go up into the hills, I will descend to the Tarai.

S.FORM: aŋ bɔʔ-tɔ ɖaɖa aŋ noʔʦo-bal lɔn-tɔ-nɔ dʰaiʔlɔ joŋja-ni luʔ-nɔ umnusi ne hobu hobu-ŋɔ ʦʰɔʔ-si-nɔ mɔ-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: I will shout from the ridge near the mountain top, I will go up and shout, then you will listen" he said, and they were on their own and stayed like that. [they need to avoid each other]

S.FORM: dʰai mu-to mu-to mɔ-ʣa-si-lɔ ne ebo kim-bi pu bɔkʦi-wa dʰai mu-m-me mama-kɔ bɔkʦi dʰi-dɔ dja-kʰa pakʰa saplɔ kʰɔiʔ-mu siʔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Time went by and there they were, and in the house, the younger brother, having said "I may meet Mother and Leopard", stopped going out into the forest.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ ne sɔma saplɔ siʔ-i-m-me ne soʔwa miʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then the Human, having left the forest, felt hungry.

S.FORM: kim-bi kim-bi nana-nusi-ja ja ebo lam-usi hoʔ-si jɔʔd-usi
S.TRANSL: In the house, the sisters were searching here and there to bring in and feed (the siblings).

S.FORM: uk malɔ ne nana-nusi-ja ho-si-nɔ kʰip-dasi-m dʰɔʔʣam ne kan-su ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: One day, the sisters spilled the snack they come and cook.

S.FORM: kan-su-lɔ ne ʣimu a-dʰoʔd-u
S.TRANSL: After it was spilled, he (the Human) found nothing else to eat.

S.FORM: ʣimu a-dʰoʔd-u ne soʔwa dʰal-ʣa soʔwa dʰal-ʣa-lɔ ne ipʰ-a-suʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: When he could not find food, he swayed from hunger, when he swayed from hunger, he fell asleep.

S.FORM: dʰailɔ ipʰ-a-ʣa-lɔ ne nana-nusi-ja mind-usi ʦʰa ɔ-bɔkʦi miʦ-a
S.TRANSL: Then when he was deep asleep, the sisters thought: "our brother is dead."

S.FORM: kim-nɔ jo-tʰɔm-bi kʰuʦ-asi ni kʰuʦ-asi-nɔ dʰas-usi ʦʰa pʰuku um-bika
S.TRANSL: They went down below the house, and dug the earth from there.

S.FORM: kʰɔlɔ sɔ-ʦɔ-nɔ tʰɔ-mu-si-nɔ um-gobo ip-dasi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then they spread many leaves, and after spreading leaves they put him to sleep inside.

S.FORM: ipd-usi-lɔ tɔkʰɔlo-bi oko solotuʔma ʦʰori barʦʰa da-kʰɔnd-usi-nɔ dʰepd-usi-nɔ um-ʦoptu upʰre ʦʰɔ-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: When they put him to sleep, they put a gourd and a knife near his head, and covered him, and jumped.

S.FORM: kʰɔlɔ kʰɔlɔ inʦi bɔkʦi-nɔ solotuma pʰɔʔ-ɔ ʦʰa inʦi bɔkʦi-nɔ tumbu pʰɔʔ-ɔ dja-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: The gourd broke, and they said "it's our brother's forehead."

S.FORM: sɔ-ʦɔ dʰur-a iŋki bɔkʦi-nɔ silu-ʦɔ dʰur-a dja-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: The tree (branches) broke, and they said "it's our brother's bones".

S.FORM: dʰanɔ lukʰe-da-si-nɔ kʰuʦ-asi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then they left.

S.FORM: kʰuʦ-asi-lɔ ne nana-kɔ bɔkʦi-kɔ jɔ ɔ-dɔnd-usi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: They left and the sisters and brother were not united.

S.FORM: dʰainɔ kʰuʦ-asi-nɔ mɔ-si-m-me um-bika anɔ kuku popo-bo hɔbaʦ-asi
S.TRANSL: Then they went, and stayed, and from there arrived up at their uncle the owl's.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ ne popo-wa pu mɔnʣi jɔ det a-det-ka pi-ka-kʰɔt-ka rəheʦʰa
S.TRANSL: The uncle (thinks) without saying that his nieces look good to eat.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ ne bɔkʦi pu ʣi lule-ja kʰɔnd-u-m mɔ-di ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then the younger sister did not really respect the warning (ie the uncle's wanting to eat them.)

S.FORM: dʰailɔ ne jo kʰuʦ-asi dʰo kʰuʦ-asi mu-to mɔ-ʣa-si mɔ-ʣa-si-lɔ ne bɔkʦi-wa ne popo ʦɔt-ka reʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then they went down and they went up, and there they were doing this, when the younger sister teased the uncle.

S.FORM: popo ʦoʔ-si popo ʦoʔ-si-lɔ ne kuku a-ʦʰoʔ-o kuku-nɔ waʔriwa a-gɔ an-lai pe-na siʦ-e pe-na
S.TRANSL: They taunted the owl, and when they taunted him, his behavior was bad "he will eat you, he will kill and eat you".

S.FORM: dʰainɔ-ŋɔ nana-kɔ bɔkʦi-kɔ jɔ oko-ŋɔ ʦʰup-mu-nɔ mu-mu inʦi same-wa-ŋɔ ɔ-dɔnd-u-m-me ɔ-dɔnd-u ʦʰɔʔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then both the older and younger sister's clan did not unite them to become and to stay as one, and they became ununited.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ luʔ-si ʦʰa lu bɔkʦi inʦi hobu hobu mo-si an juku wɔ aŋ juku wabu-lɔm tan-nisu an ʦeʦelu-lɔm kʰuʦ-a ʔe luʔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then they said "hey Younger Sister, we must stay on our own, you be down in the Tarai, and I will descend to the Tarai, and you go to the hillside."

S.FORM: dʰanɔ nana-kɔ bɔkʦi-kɔ ʦʰɔ-si-nɔ sɔ-pu buwa leʔ-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then the older and younger sisters were (on their own) and they planted two flowers.

S.FORM: an miʦ-ena an ja ebo ʦʰoʔ-na miʦ-ena-kʰo idɔ a-buwa ŋal-e aŋ ʦʰup-tɔ-kʰo aŋu ŋal-e inʦi ʦjuri idɔ hɔi luʔ-si-nɔ kʰuʦ-asi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: "If you die, you will stay around here, if you die, your flower will wither, if I die, mine will wither, this will be our sign" they said and they left.

S.FORM: nana ju wabuwa-lɔm tan-nasi ʦʰa bɔkʦi dʰo kʰuʦ-a ʦʰa-lɔ ne
S.TRANSL: The older sister descended to the flatlands, the youger sister went up.

S.FORM: bɔkʦi-ja ne kuku ʦʰo-ʣa ʦʰa kuku ʦoʔ-ʣa ne nana juku buwa-kɔ wabu leʔ-to hɔbaʦ-ani-nɔ
S.TRANSL: The younger sibling taunted the uncle, and while she taunted the uncle (by her tasty presence) the older sister, having planted her flower, arrived down in the flatlands.

S.FORM: bɔkʦi-ja ne ku kuku ʦoʔ-ʣa-nɔ ne kuku-wa ne saŋ-pa ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: When the younger sister taunted him, the uncle picked her up and ate her.

S.FORM: saŋ-pa-nɔ-m-me nana tumtoʔd-u ʦʰa bɔkʦi-nɔ buwa ŋal-a-m ŋok-to dʰok-to ja ebo ʣara lam-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: After she was picked up and eaten, her sister knew: the younger sister's flower withered, and crying and looking, she searched here and there.

S.FORM: bɔkʦi kɔpa jɔ hɔdiʔi ʣara hiʔ-ni asu-wa jɔ ɔ-dokʰoʔ-ni
S.TRANSL: Where were her sister's bones, she asked everyone, and noone saw anything.

S.FORM: uk ŋiʦi kuku hiʔ-di kʰuʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: One day she went to ask her uncle.

S.FORM: kuku-wa jɔ aŋa ne a-dʰokʰo-ŋa ma dja ʦʰa dʰanɔ jɔ hiʔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: The uncle said "I have not seen them" but even then, she asked.

S.FORM: hiʔ-lɔ ne uk malɔ kuku-wa dja ʦʰa a-bɔkʦi-nɔ waʔriwa ɔ-ʣupʰ-a aŋa pa-ŋa
S.TRANSL: When she asked, he said one day: "your sister had bad behavior, I ate her.

S.FORM: anɔ silu kʰo-dana-kʰo jam-bi go
S.TRANSL: If you (came to) take away her bones, they are here.

S.FORM: dʰam-bi go luʔ-u-m-me lo ʦʰoʔ ma umbi dʰam bɔkʦi-nɔ silu dʰiʔ-i-m-me bɔkʦi-nɔ silu pi-nɔ kʰil pi-suli bʰui-kɔ ʦuk-u-nɔ oko mɔtʰja-bi dʰanɔ tumlo mu ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: They are there," he said, and then she found her sister's bones there, and kneaded the bones with chicken shit and ash, into a pitcher, and then she prayed.

S.FORM: tumlo mu-nɔ bʰoeni ana bɔkʦi kʰjɔma tʰind-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: She prayed and she aroused her sister Khyoma.

S.FORM: tʰind-u-nɔ dja ʦʰa nana aŋ ne habo ip-ʣi-ʦu ʦʰa hɔlja-na-m tum-a-toʔd-uŋa
S.TRANSL: When she was aroused, she said "sister, I was sleeping for a long time, I did not know you had arrived."
Then her sister said: "you were sleeping because uncle ate you. I did this to you."
S.FORM: dʰanɔ nana luʔ ʦʰa an ipʰ-a-ʣa-na ma he kuka pja-na-kʰa aŋa heʔnɔ heʔnɔ mu-ŋa lo ma
daiʔ de-na-kʰo nana kuku-nɔ ʦok kuku-nɔ wake-bi a-mo-si ʣija kʰuʦ-isi-nɔ mo-si le-si-nɔ
S.TRANSL: "If you say that, sister, let us not stay in uncle's territory, let us go and be" .

S.FORM: lɔʦ-asi ʦʰa duku ne-butu ʣaiʣuma ʣaiʣuma mɔ-si-nɔ dʰoʔ bʰa-da ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: They went up above to Jaijuma, and stayed there, and she weaves.

S.FORM: dʰoʔ bʰa-si-nɔ nana pu duku-m pʰeri nana pu buwa leʔ-to ʦeʦelu hɔbaʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: They weaved, and again, older sister was above, and planted a flower and went up to the hillside.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ majum hɔba ʦʰa-lɔ ne
S.TRANSL: Then she arrived in Mayum.

S.FORM: tɔma hɔbaʦ-a-lɔ ne juku bɔkʦi-ja pu nana lukʰe-da-si-m-me ja mu-to ebo mu-to mɔ-ʣa-lɔ
S.TRANSL: Toma arrived from down below, and her sister had left her, and she stayed there, doing this and that.

S.FORM: uk malɔ ŋi seʔ-di kʰuʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: (This is now Soma's story) Then one day he went fishing.

S.FORM: ŋi seʔ-di kʰuʦ-a-lɔ ŋi seʔ-di kʰuʦ-a-lɔ ne ŋi ne a-siʦ-a lɔ matrai siʔʦ-a lɔ siʔʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: When he went to kill fish, he did not kill a fish, only a stone separated.

S.FORM: lat-to war-to lat-to war-to rek ward-u-nɔ ne aʣi aʣi aʣi dʰuwaŋɔ ʦʰɔʔ-ɔ-m-me lɔ kur-u-nɔ kʰoʔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Having removed and thrown the stone three times, later there were many, and he carried them and brought them away.

S.FORM: kim kʰoʔ-nɔ da ʦʰa da-m-me pu miʦ-a ŋi
S.TRANSL: He brought them home, and put them down, and the fish died.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ dʰam lɔ kim kʰoʔ-nɔ da-m-me ne ja ebo lɔmtʰja-lɔ ne kʰɔlɔ ʣimu dumu-ʦɔ mu-ka di-ka ʦʰa ʣa ke kʰip-ka di-ka hɔ-di-lɔ ne kʰɔlɔ minʦ-a-m
S.TRANSL: Then he brought that stone home and put it down, and while he walked here and there, it was preparing food and drink, it cooked and set out rice and curry and when he came in, everything was ready.

S.FORM: pʰeri umu sɔma hɔ-di-lɔ sul-ka-kʰɔt-kasi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: When he came again, it hid.

S.FORM: dʰam lɔ mɔ ʦʰa wairipʦo wairipʦo mɔ ʦʰa naga-nɔ ʦi
S.TRANSL: The stone was Wairipcho, daughter of Naga.

S.FORM: uma ne sɔma-bi lɔn-mu-lai dʰaiʔ mu-m ʦʰa tɔpa lalu mu-di lɔʦ-a-m ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: She came out (of the water) in a person's body, she came out in order to find a husband to love.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ dʰaiʔnɔ ne sɔma dja ʦʰa uk ŋiʦi hɔ-na idɔ a-kim-bi heʔnɔ ʣi-ka du-ka kʰɔlɔ tum-ka asa mu-da ho
S.TRANSL: Then the man said: "one day, you came here, into my house like this, and (I wondered) who is preparing all these things to eat and drink?

S.FORM: ibi ʣi-di hɔ-ni ho dja-lɔ ne ana kim-bi jatʰɔm mɔ-di-m ʦʰa kʰaiʔpa minʦuma
S.TRANSL: Come here to eat" he said. Near his house lived an evil woman.

S.FORM: dʰam hɔ-di-nɔ aŋa kʰipd-uŋa-m soʔwa miʔ-to ho-na deʔʦ-u-kʰa deʔ-to hɔ-di-nɔ ʣi-ka ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: She came and said to him: "I cooked for you, if you feel hungry, you come" she said, and saying this, she went and ate.

S.FORM: dʰai mu-to mɔ-ʣa-lɔ ne uk malɔ ninambu-lɔm-ka dja ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Time passed, and he stayed there, and one day (a god) said from the sky:

S.FORM: idɔ minʦuma kʰipd-u-m meʔe
S.TRANSL: "That woman's not the one who cooked.

S.FORM: sul-nasi-nɔ sin-u a-kim-bi ana-ŋɔ hoʔ-na-nɔ da-na-m oko mina dʰam-wa kʰip-da
S.TRANSL: Hide and see. The one you brought back and placed in your house is a person, she is the one who cooks."

S.FORM: dʰai dja-di-m-me uk malɔ pakʰa kʰɔʔ-tɔ mu-nasi-nɔ runʦʰis-wa dʰep-nasi-nɔ mɔ ʦʰa sul-nasi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: After he said that, he said one day "I will go outside" and he got himself ready and covered himself with a winnow, and stayed there and hid.

S.FORM: dʰam sul-nasi-m-bi ne aʣi ne umu-wa ne hoʔ-o-m lɔ wɔ tan-nasi-nɔ lɔ pu sɔma ʦʰɔʔ-nɔ kʰɔlɔ ʣi-mu du-ka kʰip-mu mu ʦʰa puŋ-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: From where he hid, later, the stone he had brought back came down, and the stone turned into a person and cooked all the food and drink. She prepared it.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ ne siru dʰaŋ-u-m run-dɔ dja-lɔ runʦʰis li-di bʰjaʔ-lɔ sɔma lɔbd-u ʦʰa kʰur-bi
S.TRANSL: Then, to mash the rice, she said "I will sift it" and came to take the winnow, when the man caught her by the arm.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ ne dja ʦʰa naga-nɔ ʦi-ja ne
S.TRANSL: Then Naga's child said:

S.FORM: leʔ-ʦu leʔ-ʦu leʔ-ʦu an tʰɔp-ʦuna war-ʦuna-ka kʰɔlɔ aŋɔ silu-ʦɔ jɔ rjupʰ-akʦ-a-m go
S.TRANSL: "Leave me, leave me, leave me, you defeated me and tossed me, and all my bones have broken.

S.FORM: leʔ-ʦu dja
S.TRANSL: Leave me" she said.

S.FORM: an desje a-ʦjuʔ-nan-tɔ ɔ-ʦʰen-na
S.TRANSL: "I didn't know it was you, I didn't recognize you.

S.FORM: ha aŋa dʰainɔ ɔ-war-ne aŋa jat-ne aŋ-kɔ-ŋɔ di-ne
S.TRANSL: I won't throw you, I love you, I will place you with me.

S.FORM: ana-wa aŋ siʔ-tana a-siʔ-tana luʔ-lɔ ne luʔ a-siʔ-ne ʦʰuŋɔ a-siʔ-tana ninambu a-siʔ-tana ninambu a-siʔ-ne
S.TRANSL: Will you leave me, or will you not?" he said "Tell me, 'I will not leave you.' You will not leave me, by god, you will not leave me." "I will not leave you"

S.FORM: dʰanɔ kʰirejɔʔd-u-m-me le-kʰɔnd-u ʦʰa leʔ-si-m-me umnusi mɔ-si
S.TRANSL: Then after she promised, he let her go, and after they let each other go, they stayed (together).

S.FORM: mɔ-si-m-me mɔ-si mɔ-si-m-me umnusi jɔ ɔbɔ gɔ-di-m ʦʰa bɔʔri-wa da-m ʦʰa naga ŋis-mu
S.TRANSL: After they had been together, there was what Naga had said with an oath (to give his child in marriage) to listen to:

S.FORM: lu aŋ mampa ana jat-di-ʦuna ɔbɔ a-mampa dʰum-di kʰɔiʔ-mu ʦʰo
S.TRANSL: (Wairipcho speaks) "You have loved me, and now we must go meet my parents.

S.FORM: ana a-papa pʰi-mu ʦʰo ana aŋ
S.TRANSL: You must ask my father for me.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ an-kɔ aŋ mu-tʰɔ-dɔ dja-di-m-me an ne naga-nɔ ʦi an ne kɔŋkʰa ɔ-hupʦ-ena aŋ ne hup-tɔ hɔʔnɔ tan-musi aŋ huʔ-tɔ
S.TRANSL: Then I get to be with you" she said. "You are Naga's daughter, you do not choke in water, I will choke, how will I get down, I will choke."

S.FORM: huʔ-tɔ-m-me aŋ kɔŋkʰa tʰil jaʔ ebo tʰil-dɔ-m-me an huŋ-a hɔi lu ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: "After I choke (i.e. hold my breath), when I splash water here and there, you enter" she said.

S.FORM: dʰainɔ hom kʰuʦ-i-m-bi-lɔ ŋis-u a-pap asa a-waʔriwa dʰam-go asa pa waʦʰunari dɔndunari se-mu-tɔ dʰam laʦi minʦum biŋ-dɔ dʰam-go
S.TRANSL: "When we go there, listen to my father": "whoever, through his behavior, shows the father a treasure inside there, to him I will give my daughter"

S.FORM: ɔni sɔma de ʦʰa waʦʰunari dɔndunari aŋ-kɔ ne ɔ-gɔ ma kɔpɔ-bika hoʔ-dɔ dʰanɔ naga-nɔ ʦi-ja dja ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then the man said :"I don't have the treasure, where shall I get it from?" and Naga's daughter said:

S.FORM: idɔ asu-kɔ jɔ a-ʦʰoʔ-o a-papa-kɔ pu go
S.TRANSL: "Noone has it, (only) my father does.

S.FORM: aŋa mama-kɔ kʰo-su-nɔ an bi-ne
S.TRANSL: My mother and I will bring and I will give it to you.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ se-mu-lɔ ne heʔ de-di a-papa dʰum-dana-nɔ sɔmɔ lam-di gʰɔʔ-na sɔma li-di-nɔ luʦ-ena
S.TRANSL: Then show him", she said, "and when you meet my father, he will say to you 'What did you come searching for, what did you come to take?'

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ ani ʦi pʰi-di gʰuk-ʦu-m dja
S.TRANSL: Say 'I came to ask for your child' "

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ aŋɔ oko waʔriwa bɔʔri-go se-mu-mu ʦap-dana de-di
S.TRANSL: Then he said "Are you able to show me my one promise?"

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ dja sɔmɔ hola dʰam waʔʦʰunari dɔndunari de-m bela se-mu hɔi luʔ ʦʰa dʰanɔ ʦʰend-u-nɔ kʰoʔ-nɔ da ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then he said "What is it, show me the treasure" he said, and he recognized it and took it away.

S.FORM: dʰam-bi naga tumtoʔd-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: After that Naga knew.

S.FORM: sɔma num-a ma kɔpɔ mo-di laʦ-asi paŋ-dɔ dja ʦʰa dʰam bela pi-ka raeʦʰa sɔma aʣi ne aʣi aʣi ne dja ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: When the man's smell reached him, he said "Take him out from where he is, I will eat him". Then he said "It is something to eat".

S.FORM: ni mama lu ʦʰa naga ne hɔ inʦi sɔlɔ inʦi ʦʰekuma inʦi ʦi sɔlɔme ʦʰɔʔ-ɔ kɔpɔ sɔma-ʦɔ-kɔ lɔmtʰja-m mɔ
S.TRANSL: The mother said "Naga, it is our daughter, she has become a young woman, she walks everywhere with humans.

S.FORM: dʰam gʰuʔd-u-nɔ gʰɔʔ-kʰa ne num-ja waʔwal mu-si-m mama-kɔ ʦi-ka
S.TRANSL: She brought down that smell and came" they lied, the mother and child.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ ɔmnɔ jɔ dʰaʔe-m num-e sela jɔ dʰaʔem num-e nɔmdika jɔ dʰaʔe-m num-e dʰaiʔlɔ ne hi-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: But the smell continued for days, and he asked them:

S.FORM: lu aŋa a-paŋ-dɔ laʦ-asi sɔmɔ
S.TRANSL: "Hey, I won't eat him. Take him out.

S.FORM: lam-di gɔ-m dʰam biŋ-dɔ-suŋ-dɔ
S.TRANSL: I will give him what he came searching for.

S.FORM: kʰɔʦ-ini ibi mo-ni gara ʦjuʔ-dani-kɔ jaʔ ebo wa watoʦʰari-ja tumtoʔ-dani-kʰo aŋɔ nu kʰuʦ-e lu laʦ-asi dja-nɔ luʔ-si-m-me laʔ-asi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: They come and they stay and they know, and if my relatives know, they would take away my name," he said, "Take him out" he said to them and they did.

S.FORM: laʔ-asi-m-me hi ʦʰa sɔmɔ lam-di gʰɔ-na luʔ-nɔ hi-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: After they got him out, he asked "What did you come searching for" he said, and asked.

S.FORM: aŋ ne sɔma dja ʦʰa ani ʦi pʰi-di gʰuk-ʦu-m dja ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: "I am a human" he said "I have come to ask for your child" he said.

S.FORM: lu aŋɔ bɔʔri go-di asa se-mu-mu ʦap-da idɔ waʦʰunari dɔndunari dʰam-lai biŋ-dɔ dja-lɔ ne dja ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then he said "My oath stands: he who can show me the treasure, to him shall I give (my daughter)" he said.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ idɔ pu ho dja-nɔ se-mu ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: "Then here is it" he said, and showed it.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ papa-nɔ bɔʔri wɔ ŋir-a-m-me pu luʔ anʦi dɔbɔ pu a-no duku dʰo lɔn-mu ʦʰo
S.TRANSL: Then after the father's command was finished, he said "It is not good for you two to be here, you must go out above.

S.FORM: sela anʦi ʦi-ʦa kʰɔlɔ kʰaruwa uduwa mu-nɔ ʣi-mu ʦʰo
S.TRANSL: Later on, your children will all have to do agriculture and eat.

S.FORM: idɔ kʰuʦ-asi-nɔ-nɔ njepʦ-asi njepʦ-asi-nɔ se-di-m-ʣa-ni-m ʣe-ni-lɔ ŋiʦ-ini dʰoʔ-ni sariwa huŋ-ini
S.TRANSL: Take this away and sow it and when it blooms you will be sick and suffer and disease will enter you.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ idɔ dʰupʦ-ani dʰupʦ-ini-lɔ ɔŋkɔ jɔ ŋje-kɔ
S.TRANSL: Then make music (beat this to make music), and when you make music, we too will hear it.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ jok-ka ɔŋkɔ baʣuwa tʰaruwa-lɔŋka kʰal-ekɔ joʔ-ka ruri be-kɔ luʔ-ni-nɔ hɔr luʣɔm-ʦɔ bi-kʰod-uni ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then we will send you a blessing from down below towards the Tarai" he said, and gave them cymbals and millet.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ dja ʦʰa pʰeri ʦi-ja pʰi ʦʰa paʔa anu ne waʦʰunari dɔndunari sɔ-pu go
S.TRANSL: Then the child asked again: "Father, you have two treasures.

S.FORM: oko aŋ bi-suʦ-je lu ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Could you give me one?" she said.

S.FORM: lu ma aŋu jɔ sɔ-pu ʦʰɔʔ-ɔ dʰai de-na-kʰo oko kʰoʔ ma aŋu jɔ oko ʦʰoʔ-o oko daŋ-dɔ-nɔ oko da ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: "OK, I had two. You take one, I too will have one." And he put one (aside).

S.FORM: dʰanɔ ne papa kʰaiseʔ lu-si ʦʰa waʦʰunari dɔndunari bi-si-m wale-bi
S.TRANSL: Then father said to them, at the time he gave them the treasure:

S.FORM: ʔe mɔkʦi ŋja-si idɔ idɔ ne ʣara ʣara huʦ-iki
S.TRANSL: "Hey, listen, son-in-law, all this was stolen from us.

S.FORM: hjuʔ-wa huʦ-iki ʣara lɔ sɔ huʦ-iki luʔ-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: The wind stole the stones and the trees from us" he said to them.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ ne kʰɔlɔ huʦ-iki ʣi lɔ mɔ-si-nɔ kʰuʦ-asi
S.TRANSL: Then, he stole everything from us, we stayed as stones and we went."

S.FORM: dʰai lu-si ʦʰa dʰanɔ bi-kʰod-usi bi-kʰod-usi-lɔ ne ana ʦi-wa ne mɔkʦi pu pʰiŋ-kʰod-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: And having said that, he gave (the treasure) to them and his daughter brought up his son-in-law.

S.FORM: um pu jo mɔ ʦʰa-nɔ sul-nasi-nɔ mama bi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: That too (treasure) was down below and her mother hid it and gave it to her.

S.FORM: ana mɔkʦi pu papa ruri kʰɔnd-u-m ma kɔŋkʰa ɔ-hub-ka mu-nɔ pʰiŋ-su ʦʰa lɔʦ-akʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: And the father blessed his son-in-law and made the water not choke him and sent him off, and he exited.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ dʰo lɔʦ-asi-m-me mɔkʦi-ja anɔ tɔpa pʰi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then they went out up above and the son-in-law, her husband, asked:

S.FORM: ase papa bja-si-m koi sin-isi ma lam-u luʔ-lɔ ne
S.TRANSL: "Where do we see (=where is) what your father gave us?" he searched and asked.

S.FORM: ʔe ana aŋ lukʰe-di-ʦuna-nɔ kʰuw-akʦ-ana aŋ ne hoʔle hɔʔ-di-ʦu-kʰa kʰoʔle-ni dja ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: "Hey, you left me behind and came up. It was stolen from me, and then they took it away," she said

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ ne ʔe ʦʰoʔ-e ma dja-si ʦʰa dʰaiʔ mu ʦʰa ebo
S.TRANSL: Then they said so it is, that's what they did here.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ ase lukʰe-da-ŋa ʦʰa ibi heʦi tumlo mapd-uŋa ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: But (what) I left before, I erred a little in the story.

S.FORM: ja-kʰo mama-kɔ tumlo pʰapd-uŋa-m ibi-ka pu ja-kʰo mama-kɔ nuru-kɔ mɔ-ʣa-si-m-bi
S.TRANSL: Near there, Mother (I made a mistake in the story), near there, where Mother and Leopard stayed.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ mama jo ʦi dʰo mu-to mɔ-si-lɔ ne mama ʦo kʰo ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: They continued with mother below, child above, and Mother was aging.

S.FORM: bʰo-kʰo ʦʰa dʰam bʰo-kʰo-m mama dʰi ʦʰa-lɔ ne nuru-wa dja ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: She became white-haired. Leopard met white-haired Mother, and said:

S.FORM: a-bo a-mama ibidi ja mu-mu ʣi-mu a-ʦap-da sukpa dʰo-da dja-lɔ seʔ-mu lam-u dja ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: "My mother cannot do and eat from here, she finds suffering", he said, and he tried to kill her.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ dʰaiʔ dja-ʣa-lɔ ne mama tʰinʦ-a pʰɔʦ-a
S.TRANSL: While he was saying that, Mother awoke.

S.FORM: aŋ ne ip-ʣi-ʦu ʦʰa nuru an hɔlja-na
S.TRANSL: "I have been sleeping. Leopard, you came."

S.FORM: ɔ-maʔa hule-ʦu an anɔ dɔkʦʰu-bi ne guʣikpa wɔ mo ʦʰa ma
S.TRANSL: "Mother, I arrived. There is an insect on your neck."

S.FORM: dʰam kirna dja-ka lu tʰat-kʰɔnd-u seʔ-su luʔ-nɔ-bi-lɔ ne mama-nɔ ne nuru-wa ne dɔkʦʰu-ŋɔ tʰa-su-nɔ seʔ-su ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: (An insect called kirna). "Hey, pick it off for me and kill it," she said, and Leopard picked it off her neck and killed her.

S.FORM: dʰailɔ ne sɔma-nɔ ne ebo ne kuhuli tʰiŋ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then, a black cloud was created around the human.

S.FORM: duku anɔ tɔma kʰjama-nɔ ʦɔ majum-ʦoptu buwa let-to hɔbale-si-m um-butu kuhuli-wa pʰemd-usi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Up above, his wife Khyama arrived at Mayum, planting flowers, and up there the black cloud formed.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ sɔksu-kɔ kʰiba kʰo-nɔ sɔma kʰuʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then Bear, Dog, and the human left.

S.FORM: iŋki mama idɔ seʔ-e ʦʰa ɔmnɔ lu kʰuʦ-iki dʰanɔ lam-to lu kʰuʦ-ani mama-nɔ dɔkʦʰu tʰaʔ-a-m dʰiʔ-ni ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: "Our mother was killed today, let's go, go find her." They found Mother's separated neck.

S.FORM: mama set-ka-nɔ wariwa a-ʦʰoʔ-o
S.TRANSL: The behavior of killing Mother is a bad one.

S.FORM: aŋ rilipʰu-kɔ mu-tɔ anʦi-ja mama kʰu kʰum-asi lɔ-nɔ pʰar-bi lu-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: "I have my arrow, you two, bury Mother on a stone base" he said to them.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ kʰiba-kɔ sɔksu-kɔ kʰuʦ-asi-nɔ mama kʰum-usi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then Dog and Bear went and buried Mother.

S.FORM: mama kʰum-mu ŋir-usi-m-me kʰiba pu bʰja-kʦ-a ʦʰa sɔma-bo lɔʦ-akʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: After they finished burying Mother, Dog came and left the place where the human was.

S.FORM: sɔksu pu ɔ-lɔʦ-e sɔksu dʰokʰo ʦʰa nuru-wa kʰa jɔ nuru ɔt ɔt-na-nasi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Bear does not leave, and because Leopard saw Bear, he returned.

S.FORM: sɔksu-wa ne mama wɔ pa-ʣa ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Bear was eating Mother.

S.FORM: aʣi tʰɔŋ-ka mama pa-kʰo-nɔ lɔʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: From nearby, he ate up Mother and left.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ ne pa-kʰo-nɔ lɔʦ-a-lɔ ne
S.TRANSL: Then after he ate her, he left.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ aʣi tʰɔŋ-ka lɔʦ-a-nɔ ne dja-di ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then later, when he left, he said:

S.FORM: asu-wa sɔmɔ mɔ-sina sɔmɔ kʰɔmʦ-asina habo ŋoʔ-mu ma mama miʦ-a-kʰojɔ habo ŋoʔ-mu ma re-ki-je ma dja-di-nɔ sɔma laʔ ʦʰa tumlo
S.TRANSL: "Who and what did you do? What did you discover? How much did you cry because Mother is dead, how much did you cry. Let us laugh" the man said and came out with these words.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ ne rja-ni-lɔ ne sɔksu-nɔ kɔm-bi ne mama-nɔ dosam wɔ njepʦ-a-ba ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: They laughed, and Mother's hair was scattered in Bear's mouth.

S.FORM: ʔe ana ne mama wɔ pa-na-nɔ lɔʦ-ana luʔ ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: "Hey, you ate Mother and then left" he said.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ ne sɔma-nɔ pu jɔm-seʔ ʦʰa ana nuwa-suwa bʰer-mu ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then the human was hit and died, and his brains flew everywhere.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ kʰiba-kɔ ɔt-ʦasi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then he returned with Dog.

S.FORM: ɔt-ʦasi-nɔ ne heʔnɔ mɔ-ʣa-si ʦʰa ɔbɔ ʦʰekuma hoʔle dʰaiʔnɔ-ŋɔ
S.TRANSL: They returned and stayed there for a while, and they brought their sister as well.

S.FORM: umbika sɔksu pu ana nuwa nuwami nuwam nuwaʦʰis pʰi-to pʰi-to kʰuʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: And Bear went and asked for his brain.

S.FORM: kʰɔlɔ kʰɔlɔ ʣara-bi pʰi-to kʰuʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: He went and asked for it all.

S.FORM: ʣara ʣara heʦiʦi bi-ni ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: He gave them all a little.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ bi-ni ʦʰa ʣara ʣara heʦiʦi bi-to kʰuʦ-ani-lɔ ne aʣi ne sɔlɔ-bi hɔbaʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then he gave it to them, and and when he gave it to them all, they went away, and later he arrived at a frog.

S.FORM: nuwami pʰi-di ne sɔlɔ a-bi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: The frog asked, but he didn't give him any.

S.FORM: a-bi ʦʰa ɔtɔ mu-ʣa ʦʰa sɔlɔ ne lɔb-gʰud-u-kʰa piʦihil-u-kʰa jɔ dip-nasi-nɔ kʰuʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: He didn't give him any, and he became obstinate, so he caught the frog and rubbed his head on a stone, and applied the brain and left.

S.FORM: dʰai-kʰa sɔlɔ-nɔ kʰjuʔ a-ʦʰoʔ-o-m sɔlɔ-nɔ nuwami a-ʦʰoʔ-o-m
S.TRANSL: And because the frog's habits weren't good, he had no brain.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ dʰai nuwami mu-ŋanusija
S.TRANSL: Then the brain was done.

S.FORM: dʰam dekʰi dʰaiʔ mu-ni-nɔ mama dʰaiʔ mu-ni-nɔ ɔt-nani-nɔ mɔ-ni ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: From that, they made Mother and she returned and stayed.

S.FORM: mɔ-ʣa-si-lɔ sɔma-nɔ ne ʦi ɔ-ʦʰɔʔ ma
S.TRANSL: They were there, and the human's son did not come (they couldn't conceive).

S.FORM: ʦi ɔ-ʦʰɔʔ-ɔ-m-me ne ʦʰɔmdam mu-mu ʦʰɔʔ-ɔ ase papa luʔ-si heʔŋɔ dʰam-bi ne ʦʰekuma-ʦi ʦʰɔm-ka ʦʰuʔ-mu ʦʰɔ
S.TRANSL: After the child did not come, the father said to them before that they must perform prayers, and so they needed their younger sisters as dancers.

S.FORM: ʦʰɔm-ka ʦʰekumɔ ʦʰekuma ʦʰuʔ-mu ʦʰɔʔ-lɔ ne
S.TRANSL: But where is this sister who is to become the dancer?

S.FORM: kɔpa mo a-ʦʰekuma-ʦi dja-nɔ ʦjuri mu-di pʰiŋ-usi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: He said "Where is my sister?" and sent them something as a message.

S.FORM: ser pʰiŋ-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: He sent a louse.

S.FORM: ser jɔ kjɔ-se-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: But they pinched the louse to death.

S.FORM: ʦʰɔmdam-bi ʦʰɔm-ka ʦʰe ʦʰekuma-ʦi ʦʰaŋgara pʰiŋ-usi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: To his sisters, dancers for his prayer, he sent a goat.

S.FORM: ʦʰaŋgara jɔ ja tʰja-miʦ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: The goat fell down and died.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔ mu mu-to ne pɔma pi pʰiŋ-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: That being the case, he sent a chicken.

S.FORM: pi-je kʰuʦ-a-nɔ aʣi pi-wa pu dja ʦʰa ʦʰekuma-nɔ-bo hɔbaʦ-a-nɔ kʰɔkʦulupa dja ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: The chicken went and later said, after he arrived at the sisters' : "khokchulupa", he said.

S.FORM: oko lapto hum-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: He dropped a wing (act. feather)

S.FORM: pʰjatpʰjatpʰjat bʰənda dʰaiʔ-mu-lɔ ne oho he inʦi kʰokʦulupa de-di ma idɔ pɔma ne
S.TRANSL: He said 'pet pet', and after he did that, (they said) "hey, he said Khokchulupa.

S.FORM: inʦi kʰokʦulupa de-di ma lɔ idɔ lɔpʦ-isi ne hiʦ-isi haka dʰaiʔ de-di
S.TRANSL: He said our Khokchulupa, OK, let's catch him and ask him why he said that."

S.FORM: ʣaiʣuma-bika ne kɔl-to kɔl-to kɔl-to kɔl-to pi pɔwa kʰoʔd-usi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: The chicken brought them, pursuing him, from Jaijuma.

S.FORM: pɔwa pu ja-tʰɔm bʰeʔ-e ebo bʰeʔ-e
S.TRANSL: The chicken went near there and went here.

S.FORM: pʰetpʰet mu-da oko lapto hum-da kʰokʦulupa de
S.TRANSL: He made a chicken sound, and dropped a feather, and said "Kokchulupa".

S.FORM: dʰaiʔ mu-to mu-to aʣi ne baʣuwa tʰaruwa wɔ hu-gʰud-usi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: By doing that, he brought them down to the Tarai.

S.FORM: baʣuwa tʰaruwa hu-gʰud-usi-m-me umbi mɔ-ni-m asina lukʰe-da-si-m ʦelbu-nɔ kim hoʔle-si
S.TRANSL: After he brought them down to the Tarai they stayed there, and they arrived at their mother's house which they had left before.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔlɔ bigjame-nusi ʦʰɔm-ka-bi pu risi pik-uni ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: And the sisters hung fruit at the place of the dance.

S.FORM: ʦʰɔm-ka-bi um-bika ne nana-nusi-ja ne dja-si ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: At the dance, the sisters said:

S.FORM: inʦi bɔkʦi ne miʦ-a dja-si-kʰa lukʰe-dja-si-m a-miʔ-e mo ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: "Because we said our brother was dead, we left, but he isn't dead, he is alive.

S.FORM: lɔ sɔmɔ kʰoʦ-isi-nɔ kʰoʦ-isi ma sɔmɔ kʰɔiʔ-mu ma sɔmɔ jɔ ɔ-huʦ-asi dja-si-lɔ ne mind-usi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Ok, what shall we bring? what shall we bring? Let us not bring anything", they said, and decided.

S.FORM: umnusi-kɔ gɔ-di-m sɔmɔ jɔ ɔ-gɔ-di
S.TRANSL: It occurred to them that they had nothing with them.

S.FORM: pi-nɔ lapto pu go-di umnusi-kɔ sɔmɔ jɔ ɔ-gɔ-di
S.TRANSL: They had the chicken's feathers with them, but they had nothing else.

S.FORM: lu idɔ-ŋɔ be-si luʔ-si ʦʰa-nɔ umu-ŋɔ bi-si kʰo-si-nɔ bi-si-nɔ ʦʰum-asi
S.TRANSL: "Hey let's give this" they said, and they brought it and gave it and they danced.

S.FORM: dʰam tɔma kʰjɔma da-ho-si-m bi-ho-si-m-kʰa dusaba jɔ bɔʦɔn-bi sotkʰo de-ki sɔ-pu ʦʰo
S.TRANSL: Toma and Kyoma gave them 2 pots, and even now we need two pots we call Sotkho for weddings.

S.FORM: na ʦʰum-asi ʦʰa ʦʰum-uni ʦʰɔmdam mu-ni-m-me sɔ sɔma-nɔ kʰokʦulupa jɔ sɔma tʰiŋ-u ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: They danced and danced, and after they did the prayer, Khokchulupa had children.

S.FORM: sɔma-nɔ lanʦupa-ʦi heʔe sɔ kʰokʦulupa jɔ kʰɔlɔ ʦi-ʦɔ tʰiŋ-uni ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: And Khokchulupa had many male children.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ ʦi-ʦɔ kʰɔlɔ ʦʰɔʔ-ni-m-me kʰɔlɔ ʦʰɔʔ-ni-nɔ mɔ-ni mɔ-ni-m-me sela sela ne anɔ umbi mu-mu hɔi ʦʰɔʔ-ɔ dʰai mo-ni a-dʰoʔd-uni
S.TRANSL: After the children were there, much later, his children could not stay.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔnɔ-ŋɔ umbi bɔʣa tʰaruwa-lɔŋka duku kʰo-to kʰo-to sikewa mɔkewa lam-to hobu hobu mu-to lam-to mu-to mu-to kʰɔlɔ ʦʰuk-to ʦʰuk-to kʰuw-ani-lɔ rɔmbo hɔ-kʰuw-ani ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Then from there in the Tarai, they went up, and sought skills, and they were there and arrived in Rombo.

S.FORM: rɔmbo-bika duku ɔru rɔʔdu-ʦɔ ʦʰuti ʦʰɔʔ-ni-nɔ kʰuʦ-ani ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: From Rombo, they went up and separated from other Rais.

S.FORM: ɔŋkɔ jɔ sela aŋ koju-nɔ ʦukʦu pu hɔ-kʰuw-a ʦʰa duku
S.TRANSL: Then they left, and our Koyu ancestor arrived up.

S.FORM: rawakʰola dʰin-to dʰin-to rawakʰola-butu mɔ-nɔ sela sodel huŋ-a ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: He followed the Rawakhola up and arrived up at Sodel later.

S.FORM: sodel huŋ-a-lɔ bjaksupa nu dʰi ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: When he arrived in Sodel, he took the name Byaksupa.

S.FORM: bjaksupa de-ki-m pu ʦin bʰjɔʔ-ka mina bjaksupa luʦ-iki
S.TRANSL: Byaksupa is what we call a person who filters grains in making beer.

S.FORM: dʰanɔ bjaksupa-nɔ ʦi rek ʦʰɔʔ-ni ʦʰa
S.TRANSL: Byaksupa had three children.

S.FORM: oko dʰumsa-m pu dimsuŋa oko sodel oko sonita sonita pu ʦip-seʦ-a sodel-kɔ mɔ-ni
S.TRANSL: The eldest went to Dipsung, one, Sodel, stayed in the village, while Sonita was crushed and died.

S.FORM: dʰaiʔnɔ-ŋɔ sjurime kurime-nɔ ʦʰuk-to ʦʰuk-to dusuba ɔŋkɔ-bi hɔlja-kɔ-m
S.TRANSL: Then, Syurime and Kurime were born, and now we have arrived at our time.
